alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 04 at 9:02AM EST until January 04 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING FOR EAST CENTRAL GREENVILLE COUNTY... At 902 AM EST, Storm total rainfall is averaging 3 to 3.5 inches across greater Greenville resulting in scattered road flooding across the city. River gages along both the Reedy River and Brushy Creek are in flood. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Berea, Welcome, Travelers Rest, Cherrydale Point, Donaldson Center, Paris Mountain State Park and Furman University. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
